qas.question: What was copper called in Greece?
In what area was copper first mined?
What is the Greek goddess that symbolizes copper?
What is the Roman goddess that symbolizes copper?
What property does copper have that links it to Aphrodite and Venus?
What was copper forbidden to be called in Greece?
What area was the only copper mine?
What is the Egyptian goddess that symbolizes copper?
What is the German goddess that symbolizes copper?
What property does silver have that links it to Aphrodite and Venus?

context: In Greece, copper was known by the name <a0_0><b5_0>chalkos<b5_0/><a0_0/> (χαλκός). It was an important resource for the Romans, Greeks and other ancient peoples. In Roman times, it was known as aes Cyprium, aes being the generic Latin term for copper alloys and Cyprium from <a1_0><b6_0>Cyprus<b6_0/><a1_0/>, where much copper was mined. The phrase was simplified to cuprum, hence the English copper. <a2_0><b7_0>Aphrodite<b7_0/><a2_0/> and <a3_0><b8_0>Venus<b8_0/><a3_0/> represented copper in mythology and alchemy, because of its <a4_0><b9_0>lustrous beauty<b9_0/><a4_0/>, its ancient use in producing mirrors, and its association with Cyprus, which was sacred to the goddess. The seven heavenly bodies known to the ancients were associated with the seven metals known in antiquity, and Venus was assigned to copper.
